message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS

This paper is about developing a temporal matrix factorization approach for tracking concept drift in individual user preferences in recommender systems. The paper focuses on machine learning techniques and algorithms for solving the rating prediction problem. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also deals with information retrieval (IR) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques for recommender systems, which makes cs.IR and cs.AI likely sub-categories as well. The paper also discusses the dynamics of user preferences, which falls under the scope of social and information networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper uses statistical methods for learning and regression, which makes cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a possible sub-category.
